What can I say?  Portal is one of the best puzzle games for years.  You don't have to be particularly quick or "pixel accurate" to solve the challenges, aside from racing through them to get some of the achievements if that's your bag, which is good.  Just need a bit of 3-d awareness and a bit of time to think :)

Gotta love the "I'm still alive" theme as well, worth it even if the cake is a lie :-)

Rating: 7/10

Not exactly worth the current £6.99, however it is a remarkably good game. The graphics aren't too bad, and the gameplay is very interesting (even if it is rather short). The puzzles are extremely fun to solve, as long as they're not too complex. Since you'll finish the game in a few hours, you don't have time to gain experience with the game mechanics and the game will progress too fast; eventually, you'll find that the difficulty has been raised very high and that your current knowledge is not enough to solve the puzzle without getting annoyed. However, the whole concept of 'portals' makes this game extremely interesting and it's definitely worth playing, even if it is quite short.
The sense of humor and wit this game has makes it an instant favorite. Great gift for everyone.
*Jizz*
Excellent Game

В 2007 году в свет вышел [b]Portal[/b] - экспериментальный проект от новоиспечённых энтузиастов, примкнувших к [i]Valve[/i]. Тогда ещё игра представляла с собой зависимую от Half-Life 2 игровую составляющую, но уже после своего оглушительного успеха, она стала отдельной параллелью во вселенной Half-Life.

Действие игры происходит в лабораториях Aperture Science, где ГГ должен пройти ряд "экспериментальных опытов" по исследовании природы порталов, выступая в роли "подопытной крысы". Но уже походу игры, героиня начинает понимать, что в комплексе происходит нечто странное: сотрудников или любых других живых людей нет, голос-проводник несёт ахинею про торт, а эксперименты с каждой камерой становятся всё опаснее. Доходит всё до того, что голос пытается уничтожить подопытную, и Челл (ГГ) инициирует побег с комплекса. Сюжет в этой части игры менее выражен, в виду того, что игра выступала в качестве экспериментальной головоломки, но доставляет свой интерес.

Геймплей прост в понимании, но гениален и сложен в решении пазлов. В камерах всегда можно сломать голову. Но если Вам покажется, что они просты в решении, разработчики дают возможность пройти ряд усложнённых камер на время или количество порталов. Да и вообще - портальная пушка оказалась гениальным приспособлением в прохождении игры.

Атмосфера свойственна для этой игры: довольно мирные и симпотичные монотонные камеры испытаний и электронная Ambient мелодия, после ряда испытаний и догадок по ходу сюжетной линии, сменяются угнетающей атмосферой и звуковым содержимым, а ля "fear & horror". Своего рода изолированный техногенный постапокалипсис. Разработчики умеют делать качественные проекты.

Игра хоть и выступала как эксперимент, но работа над ним была кропотливой и бережной. [b]Portal[/b] действительно заслуживает высший балл, и эта игра, воистину, является лучшим представителем жанра [i]puzzle[/i].

空間にワープホールを作れるApature　Science社開発のデバイスPortal　Gunの先進的かつ興味深い実験に参加しましょう
親切丁寧なアナウンスの下、あなたにはPortalGunの特性を活かした様々な課題が与えられます
わずらわしい人間関係に悩まされることなく、かわいいロボットを相手に実験に専念できる環境が整っています
実験で得られたデータは今後の研究開発に活かされ、社会に貢献できる仕事です
実験の最後にはご褒美のケーキもありますよ
ぜひ参加しましょう

It's hard to think of a more perfect "new"ish game.  It's a cool concept wtih excelling execution.  All puzzle sovling thinking, with a side of comic relief.  And somehow the game is mercifully free of long loading screens, bloat, and unnecessary HD 15 bajillion-bigga-bytes of graphic files.  I'm almost confused that it was released!

Best part for me was that it really isn't too long!  But, if you want to keep playing, there are 'advanced' puzzles hidden throughout the game to find.

Definitely enjoyed!

I liked Portal. It has 19 test chambers, unique gameplay, infinite possibilities, an escape, a few climatic battles, and it is great. A very very short, but awesome game that has you thinking and laughing throughout the experiance. Portal was released in a pack called The Orange Box which included the amazing Half Life 2, Half Life 2: Episode 1, Half Life 2: Episode 2, Team Fortress 2, and Portal. All of these 5 games are completly amazing, but the game that I am talking about right now is Portal. 

Portal is a First-Person Shooter that has you instead of shooting bullets, shooting portals out of a gun called the Portal Gun. The game features a silent protagonist named Chell, and a Robot named GLaDOS. The main mechanic in Portal is that if you shoot a a portal at a wall, then shoot another one at another wall, you can easily walk into that Portal and come out the other Portal. The puzzles are pretty easy at first but quickly get harder as the game goes on, introducing new objects and things to use at your disposal.

You may think that Portal is all puzzle and no plot, but you are wrong. Portal has a amazing story that is funny, dark, and fantastic all at the same time. Even though the game only took me 2 hours to beat on the first playthrough, it is still short but very sweet. 

My final thoughts on Portal is that this game is like a small slice of delicious cake, ending fast, but leaving a lasting impression on your senses. Personally I completly love this game, and after playing it, im sure you will too.

I loved playing this game through. This game means a whole lot to me because this was the first Valve game I ever played. I love that it takes place in the Half-Life Universe. I highly recommend picking this game up on Steam along with Portal 2.

Ein gutes Spiel mit (relativ) neuartigem Gemeplay. Auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert, auch wenn es an einigen Stellen noch unausgereift wirkt und das Portalsystem noch nicht so gut genutzt wird wie in Portal 2. Die Spieldauer beträgt ungefähr 4 Stunden, Coop und Leveleditor fehlen. Portal 2 ist in jeder Kategorie besser, allerdings bekommt man hier nun mal die Vorgeschichte und 4 unterhaltsame Stunden zusätzlich. Im Portal Bundle oder bei Sonderaktionen kann ich einen Kauf empfehlen, ansonsten sollte man einen Blick auf Portal 2 werfen.

Short, but excellent. Whoever thought of this was a genius. I've played games that are mazes like the original Doom games, Quake and even the Half-life series but this game is different and in a good way. A lot of FPS games are shoot 'em up games with a ton of violence and that's not a bad thing but some people in this world want an escape from that. I wouldn't say this is the most bloodless game (Robots don't bleed but there is some blood from other people) but it isn't centered around violence. Another good thing about this game is the writing. It's humor is wonderful reminding me of the Red letter day chapter of Half-life 2 (Wait what cat?) and it really is quite mind bending for its puzzles. The greatest puzzle in my opinon is the final one.
This game is the best first-person puzzle game money can buy. Unless you're adopted, in which case it's not. And you should feel terrible.
A classic game of unique, original, mind-bending genius. If you're one fo the few that have never played it, no reason to wait any longer. Your life will feel more complete afterwords.

Portal has become an icon of gaming and oddly enough it has taken me this long to actually play it. I would reccommend this game only for it's originality, really.  Great concept, using entry and exit portals to solve puzzles and transverse the maps.  The puzzles escalated in difficulty at a nice pace to properly acclimate you to the game.  However, the game was too short and not really very challenging, in my opinion.  I have yet to play the 6 advanced levels, but as the game is concerned, from beginning to end, it basically boiled down to a charming, short and sweet experience...nothing more.
If you're one of those types who MUST have all achievements in a game, then that would be the only replay value it has to offer...aside from additional dowloadable puzzles (which I am uncertain exist, but if they do, that's a definite PLUS!).
I think $10.00 is the perfect price for the content this game has to offer.  Any more and I don't think it would be worth it.  Any less and you better pick it up while it's cheap!
I will be waiting for Portal 2 to drop in price before grabbing it under the impression that it, too, will be fairly challenging and short ended.
Looking back on this game, it's still as fun now as it was a few years ago.

This game is truly amazing! It took me a while, because I got to test chamber 16 and got scared of the turrets (I was a nine-year-old wimp back then don't judge me) and I stopped playing for about a year. Then I picked it back up, and I got to the boss battle and got scared, then left for about 3 or 4 months. I finally beat it while at a sleepover at my cousin's house, and I felt like THE most accomplished person in the world. Writing this about 3 years later, I have beaten the first game about 15 times (not exaggerating) and the second one about 5 (second game is MUCH longer), and there is literally NOTHING I don't know about portal.

Oh, Portal...one of the most satisfying puzzlers I've ever played. Funny, nice to look at, and VERY replayable with the challenges and Steam Workshop. Now buy it and then buy Portal 2 when you're done. Enjoy the cake...

Rather short, but helps bring you into the Portal series magnificently. A few areas were quite hard to traverse through, not knowing where you're supposed to go or what to do, but I'm certain you'll figure it out eventually. Worth the buy.

8/10, needs a slight bit of improvement, but overall a good game.
Damm, This game tests your puzzle-solving skills to the limit, also the added futuristic vibe is great! I will pesronally thank someone who makes a fully working Portal-gun!!
